commit_message:
Allow for setting ViP ID

Allows the user to specify the id of an existing
virtual ip rather than create a new one. This
allows devices listening on different ports using
the same ip addresses.

Change-Id: Ieba48abc0470cc5b596245efa51e9919ef37e0ca

commit_message:
Split scaling policy into separate files

A further step to split the AWS and the OS version of auto-scaling group
related classes.  This patch splits the scaling policy and launch
configuration into separate files.

This patch is not breaking any existing test cases. But more test cases
will be needed for the OS version scaling policy.

Implements: partial-blueprint reorg-asg-code
Change-Id: I0f888496d92b0efb5d63b567864488ff8a45e4ac

commit_message:
Cut down on warning logs

- don't log on ignore_not_found()
- drop some logs from warn to info
- remove the "no resources in template" log
- remove the "Duplicating event" log

Change-Id: Ie4d68b43607336c8c054a32126d6a05ba4e5e15c
Closes-bug: #1346755

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-12 01:14:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Standardize AccessInfo token setting

When settings tokens via the factory v2 and v3 work completely
differently. This is somewhat expected due to tokens working differently
but it makes it hard to work with.

For example, if i have a v3 token but not the requests.Response that
created it there is no way for me to set the token data on the
AccessInfo object via factory.

Also in the case of V2 CMS tokens the value at ['token']['id'] is a fake
so that the signing process will work.

Allow overriding the token value from the factory and force setting the
token id on the AccessInfo in a standard way.

Change-Id: I856096dc5fae2ab0d1bedbac3294dc4976c3f3ad

commit_message:
Standardize AccessInfo token setting

When settings tokens via the factory v2 and v3 work completely
differently. This is somewhat expected due to tokens working differently
but it makes it hard to work with.

For example, if i have a v3 token but not the requests.Response that
created it there is no way for me to set the token data on the
AccessInfo object via factory.

Also in the case of V2 CMS tokens the value at ['token']['id'] is a fake
so that the signing process will work.

Allow overriding the token value from the factory and force setting the
token id on the AccessInfo in a standard way.

Change-Id: I856096dc5fae2ab0d1bedbac3294dc4976c3f3ad

commit_message:
Allow to decide between Nova-network and Neutron

Adds a heat.conf option to set the OpenStack component responsible for
networking, and makes heat-engine auto-discover the networking service
on start up if such option is not set.
Also adds a convenience method to Resource class to let resources decide
what networking service to use.

Implements blueprint discover-networking-service

Change-Id: If7121089068cc2d2774bedb73e4e252b520eb5b3

commit_message:
Remove assignment_api dependency on token_api

The assignment_api now uses the callback system to avoid needing
to directly call token_api for invalidating the tokens in the
token persistence system.

This change is in support of non-persistent tokens which has a
dependency on unifying interactions with the token persistence
system.

Change-Id: I66af0a7281cf9a4d451f0f6d86da8182e2cc0e60
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Port os-server-groups extension to work in v2.1/v3 framework

Ports v2 os-server-groups extension and adapts it to the v2.1/v3 API
framework. API behaviour is identical with the exception
that there is no support for XML. Also

- unittest code modified to share testing with both v2/v2.1
- Adds expected error decorators for API methods
- Adds api sample tests

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I52e49e6e85a7516e3b184601374e5c987f60a9a0

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-26 01:12:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "boolean parameter type is not recognized in the API

The boolean type that was added to Heat templates is not recognized
in the API layer. Because of this, the API passes the schema type
(which is lowercase 'boolean') directly to the client, while all
other recognized types are passed with camel case.

Change-Id: I0d31401456c0f5cd0bb81e29323e40b4de66f331

in the API layer. Because of this, the API passes the schema type
(which is lowercase 'boolean') directly to the client, while all
other recognized types are passed with camel case.

", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
boolean parameter type is not recognized in the API

The boolean type that was added to Heat templates is not recognized
in the API layer. Because of this, the API passes the schema type
(which is lowercase 'boolean') directly to the client, while all
other recognized types are passed with camel case.

Change-Id: I0d31401456c0f5cd0bb81e29323e40b4de66f331
Closes-Bug: 1361448

commit_message:
Upgrades, run iptables cleaning only for required containers

I doesn't make sence to run iptables
cleaning, for containers, which
doesn't have port bindings, e.g.
volume containers.

Change-Id: I7c313e5bb2806cbf4beb067ace6c4dc614a73281
Closes-bug: #1362544

Install latest iptables on the master node

When we run upgrade, during puppet run
it should install latest iptables from
the repository.

commit_message:
Add numa_topology column to the compute_node table

This patch adds the migration to add the numa_topology column to the
compute_node table. It also adds the field to the ORM model and the
Nova object class.

Change-Id: I4ca994662ed700a907f78aa04016b626fc351b25
Blueprint: virt-driver-numa-placement

Add a Set and SetOfIntegers object fields

topology object which will be added in subsequent patches.

subject: Ensure proper ordering of XML arguments
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-22 00:58:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Ensure proper ordering of XML arguments

Random hash ordering can cause the 'encoding' argument to be rendered
in the XML string before the 'version' argument, resulting in XML
deserialization errors on the Keystone side.  This modifies
Document's string rendering to not rely on dict ordering when
constructing the header tag's version + encoding arguments and avoids
XML auth issues when using PYTHONHASHSEED=random.

Change-Id: I66d18a2f8da1088ec5d310a43c84df7e4d6a6f6b
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-22 08:42:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Ensure proper ordering of XML arguments

Random hash ordering can cause the 'encoding' argument to be rendered
in the XML string before the 'version' argument, resulting in XML
deserialization errors on the Keystone side.  This modifies
Document's string rendering to not rely on dict ordering when
constructing the header tag's version + encoding arguments and avoids
XML auth issues when using PYTHONHASHSEED=random.

Change-Id: I66d18a2f8da1088ec5d310a43c84df7e4d6a6f6b

commit_message:
Ensure proper ordering of XML arguments

Random hash ordering can cause the 'encoding' argument to be rendered
in the XML string before the 'version' argument, resulting in XML
deserialization errors on the Keystone side.  This modifies
Document's string rendering to not rely on dict ordering when
constructing the header tag's version + encoding arguments and avoids
XML auth issues when using PYTHONHASHSEED=random.

Change-Id: I66d18a2f8da1088ec5d310a43c84df7e4d6a6f6b

subject: Correclty detected osd when the journal is a file
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2064, 'name': 'Loic Dachary', 'email': 'loic@dachary.org', 'username': 'dachary'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 9061, 'name': 'David Moreau Simard', 'email': 'moi@dmsimard.com', 'username': 'dmsimard'}, {'_account_id': 9133, 'name': 'Puppet Ceph CI', 'username': 'puppetceph', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-21 10:14:46.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/osd.pp'], 'message': 'Correclty detected osd when the journal is a file

When the journal of the osd is set to a file instead of a partition,
ceph-disk list report a normal filesystem like this:

 /dev/sda2 other, xfs, mounted on /var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-5

So we must check that /var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-5/journal point to
the journal passed to the osd class.

This patch ensure that.

Change-Id: I30ce854337d41029f3863e4cffef76685b8dcc0c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Correclty detected osd when the journal is a file

When the journal of the osd is set to a file instead of a partition,
ceph-disk list report a normal filesystem like this:

 /dev/sda2 other, xfs, mounted on /var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-5

So we must check that /var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-5/journal point to
the journal passed to the osd class.

This patch ensure that.

Change-Id: I30ce854337d41029f3863e4cffef76685b8dcc0c

commit_message:
Add cm_api to global requirements

cm_api is needed for this blueprint:
Plugin for CDH with Cloudera Manager
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/cdh-plugin

This library will be used by Sahara for provisioning clusters
with Cloudera Hadoop distribution

Licensed by Apache-2.0
This library not compatible with Python 3
Ubuntu and Fedora don't provide packages with cm_api

Partially implement: blueprint cdh-plugin

Change-Id: I638d04d8bcece055e655b4243ad9c0f8d9dd8a70

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-01 08:23:24.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/fakes.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/utils.py'], 'message': "Use immutable arg rather mutable arg

Passing mutable objects as default args is a known Python pitfall.
We'd better avoid this. This commit changes mutable default args with

commit_message:
Use immutable arg rather mutable arg

Passing mutable objects as default args is a known Python pitfall.
We'd better avoid this. This commit changes mutable default args with
None, then use 'arg = arg or []'.

Change-Id: Ib3c6c3dd836255ee2435e3045404a0b3b0b4c534

commit_message:
bashate known as bash8 should be installed from pypi mirror.

bashate is available on pypi mirror,
We can install it from there and use it in run_tests.sh
file. So, bash8.py file is removed from devstack.

Change-Id: Ibf25e2e51a582114aad3c63cea2579f14b29d350
Closes-Bug: #1320535

commit_message:
labs: fix ovs-vsctl error

By the time we try to create the internal bridge on compute and network
nodes, they have already been created, resulting in an error message.

This patch informs ovs-vsctl that the bridge may already exist.

Change-Id: Ib1b951f639d208b98769f28a66d0edff27ae6224

commit_message:
Install glance.store from git instead of pypi

In order to use python packages, we need to have all packages in a
namespace installed using the same method - either develop or install.
Therefore, we need to override the pip installed glance.store package
with one installed from the git repo.

commit_message:
document VMDK driver support for Cinder block storage

- mention that starting with Fuel 5.1 we support VMDK driver for Cinder
- explicitly state that user has to change Cinder backend after
  finishing environment creation with vCenter as hypervisor option
- update screenshot where user selects storage backends for Cinder and
  Glance, right now there is no choice available, becase currently Ceph
  cannot be used with vCenter
- add screenshot showing where user can change Cinder storage backend
- correct Cinder definition in Terminology reference, that *VMDK*
  driver enables vCenter datastores support, not *vCenter* driver
- remove limitation in Planning guide that tells that VMDK driver is not
  supported, which is not true anymore
- add limitation in Planning guide that the only supported backend for
  Cinder is VMDK driver

Implements: blueprint vcenter-documentation-update-fuel-5.1
Change-Id: Idc2412f2d897d76e68c968bb77b84e350af07cd1

commit_message:
Add recognition of 'INSERT IF NOT EXISTS'

Analyses expected_condition_map in put_item requests
whether 'INSERT IF NOT EXISTS' behavior is expected
and handles it properly

Fixes bug: 1360131

Change-Id: I02cc32325fb224fa7ce9e810be6b94f1dd9219c2

commit_message:
Add two more tests which check workflow execution

- added test that check execution of mixed workflow (Mistral v1)
- added test that check execution of direct workflow where all keywords are used
(on-error, on-success, on-finish)

Implements blueprint: mistral-workflow-execution-tests

Change-Id: I3055d0084a8f8a69bd8ac5cd51e7c5e7ce049b63

commit_message:
Next version of stable/icehouse is 2014.1.1.

pbr pre-versioning causes current sdist of stable/icehouse to have
versions leading up to 2013.2, but that is already released - we
should be leading up to 2014.1.1 in this repository.

Change-Id: If4140a5a439a5ee93566e95c0cecd30ed7eeeea5

commit_message:
Sync models with migrations.

We are using declarative_base in nova.db.models just for reflection,
not for db creation. For creation we are using migrations. Actual state
of models is not the same as the database state.

The goal of proposed bp is to sync models with migrations, fix mistakes
and add testing of migrations and db models on real backends.

bp db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I2545f93618e315547e7bbc346f7ac4aee8134ff9

commit_message:
Fix check-sanity + save-state /w disabled services

This adds a mapping for all process names described in BASE_SERVICES
and TARGET_SERVICES, allowing check-sanity to skip checking for running
processes of services that are disabled according to ENABLED_SERVICES.
It also updates grenade.sh and save-state to only dump databases that
exist.  These changes allow grenade to pass against deployments that
have disabled non-essential services in devstack.

Change-Id: Ic4b2bab88b12f33f939b9bf7aca47e930d799f3f
Closes-bug: #1355499

commit_message:
Adding cornercases for set_metadata

Aggregate_set_metadata leaves users confused because it currently
does not check for duplicate key=value parameters for addition
or a missing key for deletion. All that user sees is that "metadata has been updated"
more details in bug1292572

This patch checks for above mentioned corner cases and informs users when and why
there was no change made in above corner cases

Adding better testcases also.

   Closes-Bug: #1292572

Change-Id: I820d793ac44680295df8b2a3f58a0834f7019875

commit_message:
Source all devstack service libs for Tempest

Devstack's tempest library relies on TEMPEST_SERVICES when
configuring the service_available section of tempest.conf. This
is built as various service libraries are sourced into the environment.
This imports all relevant devstack service libraries to ensure the
services_available section of tempest.conf is accurate.

Change-Id: Iea9c08f5ce374c4343ae56adb49221737c7a55d7

commit_message:
Add within-juno dir and within-master symlink

This adds logic to upgrade_project() to call project upgrade
scripts from the within-$release directory if performing a
sideways upgrade within the same release.  A symlink named
within-master is added and linked to the current development
release to allow sideways migration testing of trunk.  When Juno
tags are cut and K opens, a from-kilo directoy should be created
and this symlink updated.

Change-Id: I770075442d05f38515e5dadf24f2c642d14d7845

subject: Set the python hash seed that tox uses to 0
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 10725, 'name': 'Sergey Gotliv', 'email': 'sgotliv@redhat.com', 'username': 'sgotliv'}]

[{'created': '2014-08-26 06:56:55.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Set the python hash seed that tox uses to 0

The current trove unit tests don't work correctly with the random
hash seed that the new tox sets by default.

This change forces the new tox to use 0 as the hash seed which
should unblock the gate until we can fix the trove unit tests
to run correctly with a random hash seed.

This change will probably need to be backported to the stable
branches to ensure that the tox tests keep working there as well.

Change-Id: Ib5c6d4d166c847ce94ec70740c5753d338687865
(cherry picked from commit 7e6cf5bfaf57ef8628c8f72ea29ecd12179fab72)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set the python hash seed that tox uses to 0

The current trove unit tests don't work correctly with the random
hash seed that the new tox sets by default.

This change forces the new tox to use 0 as the hash seed which
should unblock the gate until we can fix the trove unit tests
to run correctly with a random hash seed.

This change will probably need to be backported to the stable
branches to ensure that the tox tests keep working there as well.

Change-Id: Ib5c6d4d166c847ce94ec70740c5753d338687865
(cherry picked from commit 7e6cf5bfaf57ef8628c8f72ea29ecd12179fab72)

commit_message:
Catch BadRequest exception from correct module

Catch the correct BadRequest exception from the neutron
client module so deployments that don't support overlapping
IP addresses can be tested.

Change-Id: Ica58ffbff6cedd362e2b2b807438ec61bddf2f25
Closes-Bug: #1359508

commit_message:
Ensure assertion matches dict iter order in test

Fixes a test_linux_ip_lib test that made an assertion
on a command that was called that could fail depending
on the order of the dictionary when it was iterated over.

This patch makes the assertion match the order that the
command is constructed by iterating through the dictionary
as well.

Partial-Bug: #1348818
Change-Id: I7baa518169c193f7e98d38632e1db16eb57ffee7

commit_message:
Clear entries in Cisco N1KV specific tables on rollback

During rollback operations, resources are cleaned up from neutron
database but leaves a few stale entries in the n1kv specific tables.
This change addresses the proper clean up of tables. i.e. VLAN/VXLAN
allocation tables, profile binding and vm network table.

Conflicts:

        neutron/plugins/cisco/n1kv/n1kv_neutron_plugin.py

Change-Id: I7a09d34f3a9dee0a43b76c5d781ee9eb9938953a
Closes-bug: #1336596
(cherry picked from commit 73b4239fbef5e52494cf3ffc3293dbb79b52d91c)

subject: Require Class['mysql::server'], not Service['mysqld'] when creating DB.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6836, 'name': 'Daneyon Hansen', 'email': 'danehans@cisco.com', 'username': 'danehans'}, {'_account_id': 7155, 'name': 'Sebastien Badia', 'email': 'seb@sebian.fr', 'username': 'sbadia'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-14 18:09:34.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/db/mysql.pp'], 'message': "Require Class['mysql::server'], not Service['mysqld'] when creating DB.

When using version >= 2.2 of the MySQL module, setting up the database
for Keystone depended on the MySQL service (Service['mysqld']). However,
if the service is not managed by Puppet (e.g. it is managed through
Pacemaker instead), this would cause catalog compilation to fail because
there is no Service['mysqld']. This is the case when the MySQL module is
called with service_manage => false. Requiring Class['mysql::server']
instead fixes this.

Change-Id: I4ba7932d679764576a46ea599499991a5c57fc56
Closes-Bug: 1349316
(cherry picked from commit 5837aaeaadb14fdc089b25e666cfd8d91f0f53a6)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Require Class['mysql::server'], not Service['mysqld'] when creating DB.

When using version >= 2.2 of the MySQL module, setting up the database
for Keystone depended on the MySQL service (Service['mysqld']). However,
if the service is not managed by Puppet (e.g. it is managed through
Pacemaker instead), this would cause catalog compilation to fail because
there is no Service['mysqld']. This is the case when the MySQL module is
called with service_manage => false. Requiring Class['mysql::server']
instead fixes this.

Change-Id: I4ba7932d679764576a46ea599499991a5c57fc56
Closes-Bug: 1349316
(cherry picked from commit 5837aaeaadb14fdc089b25e666cfd8d91f0f53a6)

commit_message:
Disable Openstack services startup on install

Upstart makes services went off once installed.
We're wanting them started only then configured.
If ceph is used volumes, leave cinder-volume override
on its own (rbd.pp will configure it).

Closes-bug: #1348185
Closes-bug: #1335804

Change-Id: I50ff5b0f5bc3d80bfef917116a620bd9386e8e56
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

", 'number': 13}, {'created': '2014-06-16 08:06:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Adds REST API endpoint for action execution

Deployment is replaced with a more generic concept called 'action'.
Action can be performed on any object of Object Model.
Actions are marked with 'Usage: Action' in MuranoPL code. They can have arguments.
List of available actions can be obtained from Object Model itself after initial deployment.
This commit adds ability to REST API invoke actions by providing its unique id (from OM) and parameters.
Also refactors API code to use tasks.
Database table isn't renamed because in MySQL 5.5 this cannot be done without dropping FK constraints
in status table and this operation is not supported by SQLite. SQLite can rename table without errors but FK
constraint becomes invalid pointing to non-existing table. So renaming is done on Model level, not in DB

Change-Id: If21809340bb799af58a8d1a2d148e52565028970
Partially-Implements: blueprint application-actions
", 'number': 14}, {'created': '2014-07-31 14:58:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Adds REST API endpoint for action execution

Deployment is replaced with a more generic concept called 'action'.
Action can be performed on any object of Object Model.
Actions are marked with 'Usage: Action' in MuranoPL code. They can have arguments.
List of available actions can be obtained from Object Model itself after initial deployment.
This commit adds ability to REST API invoke actions by providing its unique id (from OM) and parameters.
Also refactors API code to use tasks.
Database table isn't renamed because in MySQL 5.5 this cannot be done without dropping FK constraints
in status table and this operation is not supported by SQLite. SQLite can rename table without errors but FK
constraint becomes invalid pointing to non-existing table. So renaming is done on Model level, not in DB

Change-Id: If21809340bb799af58a8d1a2d148e52565028970
Partially-Implements: blueprint application-actions

commit_message:
Adds REST API endpoint for action execution

Deployment is replaced with a more generic concept called 'action'.
Action can be performed on any object of Object Model.
Actions are marked with 'Usage: Action' in MuranoPL code. They can have arguments.
List of available actions can be obtained from Object Model itself after initial deployment.
This commit adds ability to REST API invoke actions by providing its unique id (from OM) and parameters.
Also refactors API code to use tasks.

Change-Id: If21809340bb799af58a8d1a2d148e52565028970
Partially-Implements: blueprint application-actions

commit_message:
[Hbase] Adds new functions redesigning keys for data storing

Function prepare_key constructs keys with column as separator.
Other methods "quote/unquote" deal with data that is used in keys construction.
Function "quote" exchanges all columns that it finds in getting params.
"unquote" restores getting data for its initial state.

Related-bug: #1328114

provider rather than simple 50[34].

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary parameter from config

Tenant_isolation parameter is duplicated in Compute and Orchestration
sections of config.py, but according to code it's used only of
Compute section and no sense to define it in other places.

Closes-Bug: #1340380
Change-Id: I198e0f3d8a0f7e2f91ed98f6f7deab90454f993d

commit_message:
Upgrades, handle socket.timeout exception in health checker

It happens not often, but sometimes
when we make http call, it raises
socket.timeout exception.

* handle socket.timeout exception
  in health checker
* also fixed wrong log message
  in health checker

Change-Id: I9f90540a6ea3687b0f9fd640242af02e50c5d484
Closes-bug: #1362508

commit_message:
Convert create_backup v3 plugin to v2.1 API

Changes required to have v3 plugin natively support the V2.1
API

The create_backup action is reverted back to createBackup

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

commit_message:
Implementing task execution infrastructure

* Implemented action calls
* Implemented subworkflow calls
* Adding executor interface and default implementation
* Unit tests
* Small refactoring in workflow handlers
* Creating all necessary RPC infrastructure
* Refactoring launch script
* Added __repr__() implementation to MistralContext
* Small fixes in old infrastructure

Change-Id: I134ea526c295ca9bda7214c5403a41966062ff79

commit_message:
properly format user guide in RST

The user guide isn't formatted properly for RST. Cosmetically,
the lines are too long and some have extra non-printing characters.
Lists aren't formatted for RST.

This fixes the file so that the lines are no more than 80 characters
wide, removes the non-printing characters, and makes use of
RST-formatting for the lists.

The text itself is not modified.

Change-Id: I8d2f3e4723e619014c056946e4f226d9c0e8f48a
Partial-Bug: #1353688

commit_message:
Change Log level from ERROR to DEBUG

When adding a subnet interface to router, an interface inside the
router namespace created, and parallely vpn-agent periodically executes process_router,
which checks existense of interface inside the router namesapce,
and if not exists then print error log and call the self.driver.plug,
so changing that log level from error to debug based on parameter check_exit_code.

Change-Id: Ic5e5b07d6cda70fa4a8dc28cf6937cb4b49735a2
Closes-Bug: #1332789

commit_message:
Add dib-lint exclusions

This patch adds exclusions for the indentation and newline
rules in dib-lint.  The indentation exclusion is needed for
files using heredoc and wanting to preserve indentation.
The newline exclusion is added here for consisently treating
all dib-lint rules the same.

Change-Id: Ic8a2164eba3cf99e55473846e3a5fe663a3c1095

commit_message:
labs: exit for invalid syntax

Make osbash exit with an explanation if no option for building VMs (-b),
creating Windows batch scripts (-w), or exporting node VMs (-e) is given
(there is nothing to do).

Change-Id: I2376a792fcd6303c64a21f4378acb15bd99a476f

commit_message:
Return BadRequest instead of UnprocessableEntity for volumes API

Changes exception from UnprocessableEntity to BadRequest when
input validation fails. Also raise BadRequest instead of a nova
exception InvalidParameterValue within the SnapshotController
create method. This is some preparation work to make sharing
unittests between V2.1 and V2 easier.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I5c5b6f9680378d51f7fea054b52b99cd6cbe54b0

[{'created': '2014-08-27 15:08:58.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/functional/sanity_check.py', 'muranodashboard/environments/consts.py'], 'message': "Rename 'Configuring' state to 'Ready to deploy'

'Configuring' is a confusing state since it implies
that some process is running on the background.
But that is not true.
Status 'ready to deploy' indicates that deployment has not been started,
but ready to begin after corresponding button will be pushed

Change-Id: Ia3f0c9036aa989c974fb64563984324ace7bea41
Closes-Bug: #1357220
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Rename 'Configuring' state to 'Ready to deploy'

'Configuring' is a confusing state since it implies
that some process is running on the background.
But that is not true.
Status 'ready to deploy' indicates that deployment has not been started,
but ready to begin after corresponding button will be pushed

Change-Id: Ia3f0c9036aa989c974fb64563984324ace7bea41
Closes-Bug: #1357220

Remove functionality to load json files

Remove schema loader since all schemas are ported to .py files.

Implements: bp api-schema-unification

commit_message:
Convert multinic v3 plugin to v2.1

Changes required to have v3 plugin natively support
the v2.1 API.

add_fixed_ip -> addFixedIp
remove_fixed_ip -> removeFixedIp

Removes v3 version of the multinic test and changes to
share use of the v2 unittests code. Backports a v2.1 specific
test.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ie01eddf1e772092c291b1475404f87e6e6f47c71

commit_message:
Backport v3 multinic tests to v2

Adds tests which were only added to the v3 version of the multinic
unittests. Also renames oddly named test file. This is prep work
for a follow patch to share unittests between v2 and v2.1

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I87ad4d7bfb2f65f60d812dbe29866f28f776145f

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-20 21:54:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make L3RpcCallback a separate callback class

RPC has a version of itself. In Neutron a plugin implements
several RPC interface, so a single RPC version doesn't work.
In Mixin callback class approach, RPC versioning depends on
each plugin implementation and it makes harder to maintain
RPC version appropriately. This patch series replaces mixin
PRC callback of server side with a separate class.

This commit handles L3-agent RPC callback.

Partial-Bug: #1359416
Change-Id: Ie3f2c9b2ad907a1110e05fe94d42e41e93fbcaa7

commit_message:
Make L3RpcCallback a separate callback class

RPC has a version of itself. In Neutron a plugin implements
several RPC interface, so a single RPC version doesn't work.
In Mixin callback class approach, RPC versioning depends on
each plugin implementation and it makes harder to maintain
RPC version appropriately. This patch series replaces mixin
RPC callback of server side with a separate class.

This commit handles server-side callback of L3-agent RPC interface.
L3-agent server-side callback class is moved from db/ to
api/rpc/handlers because it doesn't involve any db operations
and defining all RPC interfaces in a single place sounds reasonable.

Note that moving other L3-agent related RPC interface class
to api/rpc/handlers will be done in a separate patch as this patch
focuses on reorganizing the server-side RPC callback class.

Partial-Bug: #1359416
Change-Id: Ie3f2c9b2ad907a1110e05fe94d42e41e93fbcaa7

commit_message:
Make SecurityGroupsRpcCallback a separate callback class

RPC has a version of itself. In Neutron a plugin implements
several RPC interface, so a single RPC version doesn't work.
In Mixin callback class approach, RPC versioning depends on
each plugin implementation and it makes harder to maintain
RPC version appropriately. This patch series replaces mixin
RPC callback of server side with a separate class.

This commit handles server-side callback of security group
RPC interface.
* The server-side callback of Security group RPC is moved to
  api/rpc/handler and db/securitygroups_rpc_base now only
  contains a mixin class to add agent-based security group
  implementation with db operations.
* get_port_from_device method in server-side callback class
  is moved to a mixin class of plugin implementation
  (SecurityGroupServerRpcMixin) because it involves DB lookup
  and is tightly coupled with plugin implementation rather
  than RPC interface definition.

The following items will be planned in later patches
to avoid drastic changes in a single patch.
* Merge security group RPC API and agent callback classes in
  agent/securitygroups_rpc into api/rpc/handlers/securitygroup_rpc
* Remove completely duplicated db access code in get_port_from_device
  and get_port_and_sgs

Partial-Bug: #1359416
Change-Id: Ia6535217d2e3b849a95667c1b53dd09675002892

Move get_port_from_device from RPC callback to plugin mixin

Change-Id: I784cb203eb09286f7677c93032fe6288656d9b10

commit_message:
Add Ironic-python-agent support to devstack-gate

IPA is now upstreamed and needs gate jobs running. This adds support
needed to run gate jobs.

Change-Id: I1cbb2f09b10dd36fbd40e9a20d0ddabdfa1e1192

commit_message:
Minor refactoring for add_router_to_l3_agent

This method is more complicated than it needs
to be, and it makes it difficult to target
fixes for it.

Furthermore, this method calls into
auto_schedule_routers, which duplicates some
of the DB calls already made in the above
mentioned method. This refactoring
is done in preparation of the performance
improvement.

Partial-bug: #1356121
Related-Bug: #1358636

Change-Id: I9a0cfa41a5f067949b964d39157def55c40bf9af

commit_message:
Revert "Remove docutils pin"

This reverts commit c89fc517f19ed2c631434cccd378d2e80f7cc42a.
The previous change of all repos missed all the specs repositories that contained also a docutils pin.
Patches for *-specs repositories will get generated now with ID I9107884d964757a9154bdd1feb4ea6df4e9df43e.

Change-Id: I7eae1b50cc48b00eb62ab7667cec7bddf9916611

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-24 03:09:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes a CLI issue with the DVR

Recent bug fix for the NeutronClient
that fixes the usage block on router_create
for the --distributed flag introduced another
problem were it no more honors the
--distributed=true and --distributed=false
for router create.

The current patch set allows admins to
create_router with --distributed=true and
--distributed=false.

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr
Closes-Bug: #1347960

Change-Id: I37fbd321ccb184c8d8349122c7326951f8494b52

commit_message:
Fixes a CLI issue with the DVR

Allows to set the distributed flag for
DVR.

--distributed=True and --distributed=False
for router create.

The current patch set allows admins to
create_router with --distributed=True and
--'distributed=False.

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr
Closes-Bug: #1347960

Change-Id: I37fbd321ccb184c8d8349122c7326951f8494b52

[{'created': '2014-07-28 02:45:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Predictable iptables chains output order

This fixes the iptables unit tests that break with a randomized PYTHONHASHSEED
(see the bug report).

The chains for iptables are stored as sets to avoid duplicates. When they are
output by iptables_manager their order can therefore be unpredictable. This was
found to be the case when the PYTHONHASHSEED was randomized by the new version
of tox. Found with PYTHONHASHSEED='1016732220'.

There are two parts to this fix:
1. Sort the chains output by iptables_manager
2. Update the unit tests to check for sorted chains

Note: There are several other unrelated unit tests that also break with a
randomized PYTHONHASHSEED, but they are not addressed here. They will be
addressed in separate patches.

Partial-bug: #1348818

Change-Id: Ic3f4cd85316c9fc2e78bc7f5e900cfac87baf39d
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-10 04:55:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Predictable iptables chains output order

This fixes the iptables unit tests that break with a randomized PYTHONHASHSEED
(see the bug report).

The chains for iptables are stored as sets to avoid duplicates. When they are
output by iptables_manager their order can therefore be unpredictable. This was
found hash seed 1016732220.

To fix this we:
 - Sort the chains output by iptables_manager
 - Update the unit tests to check for sorted chains

When multiple tables are processed, they can be processed in any order or
dumped in any order. Found with hash seed 3728666619.

To fix this we:
 - Traverse the tables in sorted order for dumping
 - Fix tests to allow for tables to be processed in any order

Note: There are several other unrelated unit tests that also break with a
randomized PYTHONHASHSEED, but they are not addressed here. They will be
addressed in separate patches.

Partial-bug: #1348818

Change-Id: Ic3f4cd85316c9fc2e78bc7f5e900cfac87baf39d

commit_message:
Predictable iptables chains output order

This fixes the iptables unit tests that break with a randomized PYTHONHASHSEED
(see the bug report).

The chains for iptables are stored as sets to avoid duplicates. When they are
output by iptables_manager their order can therefore be unpredictable. This was
found hash seed 1016732220.

To fix this we:
 - Sort the chains output by iptables_manager
 - Update the unit tests to check for sorted chains

When multiple tables are processed, they can be processed in any order or
dumped in any order. Found with hash seed 3728666619.

To fix this we:
 - Traverse the tables in sorted order for dumping
 - Fix tests to allow for tables to be processed in any order

Note: There are several other unrelated unit tests that also break with a
randomized PYTHONHASHSEED, but they are not addressed here. They will be
addressed in separate patches.

Partial-bug: #1348818

Change-Id: Ic3f4cd85316c9fc2e78bc7f5e900cfac87baf39d

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-08 14:35:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Filters: Adds ability to configure max_instances_per_host from aggregates

Is now possible to use the filter AggregateNumInstancesFilter and
define an aggregate with a metadata "max_instances_per_host" to
configure the max instances can be hosted by hosts.

  + Creates new filter AggregateNumInstancesFilter
  + Adds a base class for NumInstancesFilter
  + Updates devrefs for: NumInstancesFilter and AggregateNumInstancesFilter
  + Adds unit tests for AggregateNumInstancesFilter

Note:
  This upgrade was largely inspired from AggregateRamFilter
  and AggregateCoreFilter.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I569aab7842d2c67042b89c75941a4664a599a7f6

filter: add per-aggregate filter to configure max_instances_per_host

commit_message:
Remove sahara-dashboard installation

Sahara dashboard is now merged into the Horizon and enabled by default
(when data_processing endpoint is available), so, we should stop
installing it as separated dashboard.

Change-Id: I5636e9f51fb3072c30407032a6346b391c288a2c

commit_message:
Fix CLI support for DVR, take 2

Previously --distributed was displayed as positional
argument in the help text, but acted as an optional
argument with the -- semantics. It now behaves like
any other optional argument.

A side-effect is that previously you could:
1) neutron router-create --distributed r1
2) neutron router-create --distributed=True r1
3) neutron router-create --distributed=False r1

While now only options 2 and 3 are viable.

DocImpact
Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr
Closes-Bug: #1346121
Change-Id: I60675b4f60fe8154af4ab6d8f0e93867cf362a59

commit_message:
Prefer "val !=/== ref" over "val (not) in [ref]" in conditions

This change increases readibility with the following replacements in
conditions:

 * val in [ref] ==> val == ref
 * val not in [ref] ==> val != ref

Change-Id: I52a77aff60c8e46fa5f6290e3a565f58425d9a68

[{'created': '2014-08-18 22:21:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix some of tests that rely on hash ordering

With tox 1.7.2 hash randomization will be on by default, causing
random failures of tests. How to reproduce:
* Update tox
* Remove "PYTHONHASHSEED=0" from tox.ini
* Run something like:
  $ for i in {1..20}; do tox -epy27 || break; done

Changes:
* Made most of generated stuff predictable by adding sorting

Not done:
* Current API validation checks nothing relying on specific response for
  specific hash. I tried to test it based on regexp patterns but it
  looks like more discussion is needed. See
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/112736/ for more details. This patch
  is a part that can be done without regexps.

Change-Id: I92a714cf9c29547e875170547a6c0625ddaebc88

commit_message:
Fix some of tests that rely on hash ordering

With tox 1.7.2 hash randomization will be on by default, causing
random failures of tests. How to reproduce:
* Update tox
* Remove "PYTHONHASHSEED=0" from tox.ini
* Run something like:
  $ for i in {1..20}; do tox -epy27 || break; done

Changes:
* Made most of generated stuff predictable by adding sorting

Not done:
* Current API validation checks nothing relying on specific response for
  specific hash. I tried to test it based on regexp patterns but it
  looks like more discussion is needed. See
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/112736/ for more details. This patch
  is a part that can be done without regexps.

Change-Id: I92a714cf9c29547e875170547a6c0625ddaebc88
Partial-Bug: #1348818

commit_message:
Create RemoteFSSnapDriver class

Move RemoteFSDriver into its own file.

Refactor pieces needed for qcow2 snapshots into a class.

Also add self.SHARE_FORMAT_REGEX.

Implements bp: remotefs-snaps

Change-Id: I8f9eaed125f4b916b835a63b04239058e34492a9

commit_message:
Filter out registered nodes with ironic

As a first step to making register-nodes idempotent, also filter
out nodes that are registered with ironic before performing node
registration.

Change-Id: Ia0f5eaf2728cc2caf7f59546d226ddc6bd337b77

commit_message:
Permit usage of notifications for metering

This patch introduces a new publisher that uses notification instead
of RPC.

And set it by default.

Closes bug: #1005933
Implements blueprint replace-rpc-cast-with-notifications
Co-Authored-By: Ala Rezmerita <ala.rezmerita@cloudwatt.com>

Change-Id: Idc40c148ef60d5e1349d30c66ba85691d93c5675

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2014-08-20 13:09:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix for LBaaS VIP Ports to be serviced by DVR

Currently, DVR router namespaces are created only
when there is a valid VM port on the compute
node, or for the gateway-port on the service node.
But when an LBaaS VIP port is created the l3 agent
does not create a DVR namespace to service the VIP port.
This fix enables DVR namespaces to be created to
service the LBaaS VIP port.

Also, this fix enables L2 Agent running in DVR
mode, to add-in OVS rules to enable packets to
be routed to such LBaaS VIP Ports which are
resident on DVR routed interfaces.

Therefore, with this fix both East-West and
North-South traffic will be serviced by DVR
for LBaas VIP Ports.

Change-Id: I698b971d50721fb0512a11569f7d3139d0d456f3
Closes-Bug: #1356464

commit_message:
Fix DVR to service LBaaS VIP Ports

Currently, DVR router namespaces are created only
when there is a valid VM port on the compute
node, or for the gateway-port on the service node.
But when an LBaaS VIP port is created the l3 agent
does not create a DVR namespace to service the VIP port.
This fix enables DVR namespaces to be created to
service the LBaaS VIP port.

Also, this fix enables L2 Agent running in DVR
mode, to add-in OVS rules to enable packets to
be routed to such LBaaS VIP Ports which are
resident on DVR routed interfaces.

Therefore, with this fix both East-West and
North-South traffic will be serviced by DVR
for LBaas VIP Ports.

DocImpact

Authored-by: Swaminathan Vasudevan <swaminathan.vasudevan@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vivekanandan Narasimhan <vivekanandan.narasimhan@hp.com>

Change-Id: I698b971d50721fb0512a11569f7d3139d0d456f3
Closes-Bug: #1356464

commit_message:
Add oslo.serialization

Add the new Oslo library for managing object serialization. This code is
moving out of the incubator into a library, so projects that wish to
continue using it need the requirement added to the global list first.

Change-Id: Iff29ce2e88cddc2332229cfbbc518251dd2c76f3

unstable unittests errors.

commit_message:
Correct return code

When a nova-api call is made with a token, the middleware
verifies the token with keystone. Even if the response from
keystone is an internal error the response shown to user is
401 (unauthorised). Checked the return code in verify_uuid_token()
and raised an exception and then caught it in _validate_user_token()
and then raised an ServiceError exception.

Closes bug: #1112167

Change-Id: I84d8db6d277720d5a81fd16f0027b0309862b80f

commit_message:
One Convergence: Skip all tests with 'v6' in name

Adds a check to the test setup for the One Convergence tests
to look for v6 in the name of the test and skip it if present.
This prevents IPv6 developers from having to explicitly skip
each new IPv6 test in the One Convergence unit tests until the
plugin gains IPv6 support.

Closes-bug: #1361366
Change-Id: I5c17d7290302597d5c85ef2c1df95f4f71e1a69b

The requirements repository is where the integration test is run
from, this is a copy of the pbr integration.sh script to the
repository that actually does the work for validating updates to
the OpenStack global requirements. Housing this script outside
of the requirements repository is a little bit odd.

Once the script is relocated to the requirements repository the
gate and check jobs can start referencing the new location.

Change-Id: Ie1d8415bbfb0c2148352dd7fd61f774ff1502003
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Copy pbr/tools/integration.sh to the requirements repo

The requirements repository is where the integration test is run
from, this is a copy of the pbr integration.sh script to the
repository that actually does the work for validating updates to
the OpenStack global requirements. Housing this script outside
of the requirements repository is a little bit odd.

Once the script is relocated to the requirements repository the
gate and check jobs can start referencing the new location.

Change-Id: Ie1d8415bbfb0c2148352dd7fd61f774ff1502003

commit_message:
Fix creation of cifs entry in cmode driver

Cmode driver tries to create NetBIOS name in cifs server and fails, because
this name should be unique, but driver did not use unique value for it.
Also removed silent passing when cifs entry was not created.

Change-Id: Ic05c7a0d2e6c544d06eb5f1e255c21083e5e6938
Closes-Bug: #1356387
Closes-Bug: #1356395

commit_message:
Updated documentation of "DummyProvider to "ExistingServers"

ExistingServers replaced DummyProvider in code
a while ago, but documentation was not updated to reflect
the change until now.

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-23 20:38:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Support reserving ips at network create time

It is horribly inefficient to create a network and reserve a large
swath of ips, so allow the network creator to specify which ips
he wants to be available in the network by specifying allowed_start
and allowed_end.

Something like:

network-create foo --cidr 10.0.0.0/24 --allowed-start 10.0.0.5 \
    --allowed-end 10.0.0.250

would ensure that 10.0.0.0-10.0.0.4 and 10.0.0.254-10.0.0.255 are
marked reserved so instances would be assigned addresses from the
middle of the range.

Partially-implements blueprint better-support-for-multiple-networks

commit_message:
Support reserving ips at network create time

It is horribly inefficient to create a network and reserve a large
swath of ips, so allow the network creator to specify which ips
he wants to be available in the network by specifying allowed_start
and allowed_end.

Something like:

network-create foo --cidr 10.0.0.0/24 --allowed-start 10.0.0.5 \
    --allowed-end 10.0.0.250

would ensure that 10.0.0.0-10.0.0.4 and 10.0.0.254-10.0.0.255 are
marked reserved so instances would be assigned addresses from the
middle of the range.

Partially-implements blueprint better-support-for-multiple-networks

Change-Id: I5427e1a2d202658d374292559fc7054f2fa51124

commit_message:
Updated documentation of "DummyProvider" to "ExistingServers"

ExistingServers replaced DummyProvider in code
a while ago, but documentation was not updated to reflect
the change until now.

Change-Id: Idcfa896099c9248f770f072135c605e72088cb59

commit_message:
ext-gw update on dvr router improperly handled by l3-agent

The recently added external_gateway method does not check
the agent mode or host binding before adding an external
gateway to a particular node/agent.  This fix adds the
required checks in the update path.

Change-Id: Idbb76eea1faec1c5d6b7615d23d74760cc327bb2
Closes-bug: #1356734

commit_message:
Fixes Neutron configuration

Fixes configuration for interface_driver. The driver configured was
nova.networklinux_net.LinuxOVSInterfaceDriver which is for flat
networks. In our labs cluster we are supporting L3 layer
functionality which is provided by
neutron.agent.linux.interface.OVSInterfaceDriver.

Change-Id: I71d971a27afea377e27eb8acbb46d283a62b5aa3

commit_message:
Expand baremetal nodes coverage `POST`

Expand `POST` tests for create baremetal nodes API:
    - expand post tests
    - added negative post tests
    - added parameters for Ironic's admin API which driver to use
      in config

easily call any program as if it were a function

Our first use would be in solum, to use git in python code, instead
of having complicated subprocess call for each git command

commit_message:
Add sh as a requirement

sh module is an interface to use subprocess. It would allow us to
easily call any program as if it were a function

Our first use would be in solum, to use git in python code, instead
of having complicated subprocess call for each git command

sh is available on pypi here https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sh
documentations & examples http://amoffat.github.io/sh/

Change-Id: If8b34ed1ffa4cdd57ef3e60dfb964ae244436ddd

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-03 03:24:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Garbage collect neutron ports not in nw_cache

This patch adds code which garbage collects ports in neutron that are
not found in nova's network cache and thus should be deleted. These ports
usually manifest when nova-compute fails to receive a response from neutron
when creating a port due to a timeout. This patch adds a new method to
nova/utils.py lock_instance(name) which is needed in order to prevent a
possible race condition when hotplugging a network-interface to an instance
and the port is garbage collected before put into the network_cache.

Related to blueprint nova-api-quantum-create-port
Related to blueprint smarter-network-cache-update

Change-Id: I1435b73756fe8f0702e2377a486e0a75ff0480bc

commit_message:
Garbage collect neutron ports not in nw_cache

This patch adds code which garbage collects ports in neutron that are
not found in nova's network cache and should be deleted. These ports
usually manifest when nova-compute fails to receive a response from neutron
when creating a port due to a timeout. This patch unfortunately needs to wrap
allocate_for_instance in @synchronized() in order to prevent a
possible race condition when hotplugging a network-interface to an instance
and the port is garbage collected before its put into the network_cache.

Closes-bug: #1324934

Change-Id: I1435b73756fe8f0702e2377a486e0a75ff0480bc

commit_message:
Adds support to set admin password from the cli

The API already supports this feature. This should be used as
nova boot --image <image> --flavor <flavor> --admin-pass <pass> vm-name

However, not all hypervisors support this

Change-Id: I1177e3b2a9284f62b061b7d806f0754a59d8cb5f
Closes-Bug: #1248517
DocImpact

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-26 14:24:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Clean up _from_db_object() in object models to reuse the base one

There are a lot of places where _from_db_object() functions are the same,
for example, dns_domain, instance_action, instance_event, instance_fault,
instance_info_cache, keypair, migration, security_group, and virtual_interface.

For others, though their implementations of _from_db_object() are a bit
different, they are able to reuse some common function defined in the base
class, and add their own specific differences.

The patch is to clean up the redundancies and make the code clean by moving
the generic implementation of _from_db_object() to the base class, and either
calling it in different implementations in the sub-classes or inheriting it
from the base class in the sub-classes.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects.

Change-Id: Iac144b3e4563bc79eda439ce7f218218ac530c66

commit_message:
Clean up _from_db_object() in object models to reuse the base one

There are a lot of places where _from_db_object() functions are the same,
for example, dns_domain, instance_action, instance_event, instance_fault,
instance_info_cache, keypair, migration, security_group, and virtual_interface.

For others, though their implementations of _from_db_object() are a little bit
different, they are able to reuse some common function defined in the base
class, and add their own specific differences.

The patch is to clean up the redundancies and make the code clean by moving
the generic implementation of _from_db_object() to the base class, and either
calling it in different implementations in the sub-classes or inheriting it
from the base class in the sub-classes.

Change-Id: Iac144b3e4563bc79eda439ce7f218218ac530c66

Eliminate duplicate code with some refactor using _status_timeout to wait for
resource deletion.

instead. This fixes the bug mentioned bellow.

commit_message:
Refactors cleanup resource for scenario

Eliminate duplicate code with some refactor using _status_timeout to wait for
resource deletion, which includes a possibility to choose which method to call
trying to get object status, since security group rules doesn't implement it,
preventing us to know if it's deleted or not.
Also removes a hardcoded 10 seconds timeout using CONF.compute.build_interval
instead. This fixes the bug mentioned below.

Fixes bug #1276781

Change-Id: I5711edfd563d55a86238291edc127c0a062dbbf3

[{'created': '2014-06-26 05:59:34.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Add python-mistralclient to requirements

Solum is adding new features that allow for user customizable CI
pipelines. Our first implementation uses mistral as the workflow
service. Note that stackforge/solum is currently listed in
projects.txt, and would like to remain there for two key reasons:

1) To use the same set of requirements of OpenStack distributions.
2) To benefit form the automated Jenkins bot reviews as requirements
change.

Solum is deeply integrated with a number of OpenStack services, so
it's critically important to our success to be closely aligned on
requirements. We are reluctant to implement our own workflow service
when one already exists in the stackforge community.

Other alternatives were explored. For reference, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-June/038609.html

Change-Id: I6bcf796d9b62aa34bd5017ae6775a050e5c712af
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add python-mistralclient to requirements

Solum is adding new features that allow for user customizable CI
pipelines. Our first implementation uses mistral as the workflow
service. Note that stackforge/solum is currently listed in
projects.txt, and would like to remain there for two key reasons:

1) To use the same set of requirements of OpenStack distributions.
2) To benefit form the automated Jenkins bot reviews as requirements
change.

Solum is deeply integrated with a number of OpenStack services, so
it's critically important to our success to be closely aligned on
requirements. We are reluctant to implement our own workflow service
when one already exists in the stackforge community.

Other alternatives were explored. For reference, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-June/038609.html

Change-Id: I6bcf796d9b62aa34bd5017ae6775a050e5c712af

commit_message:
Cleanup of grenade and old/new log copy

This change consolidates the "old" and "new" parts of the log-copy
process into a more consise flow.

Variables OLD_LOG_TARGET and NEW_LOG_TARGET (rename from non-standard
NEWLOGTARGET) are introducted.  The devstack log copy process is
considiated into one block rather than two separate parts.  After
that, several areas that were individually copying parts from the old
and new source tree are combined into one looped copy of a single
canoncial variable EXTRA_COPY

Change-Id: Iddf99555db06d8396c4111a3d77438f904643801

commit_message:
Use /usr/bin/env python instead of /usr/bin/python

The usage of /usr/bin/env ensures that the first interpreter
found in the environment's $PATH variable is used. This should
be preferred.

Change-Id: Ifca0c47f2d1b123b4d5f9fb5e98191262ed25bca

commit_message:
Get meters query performance improvements using index.

Added a index for meter_id and resource_id on the sample table
This gives a 9x performance improvements for mysql v5.5 and 2.58x
improvement for Mysql v5.6.

Add a filter filter on the sub-query when project-id or resource-id
filters are specified in the input.

Closes-Bug: #1320257

Change-Id: I562046f8f0b49e199df63db08eb57cdc46aca73c

commit_message:
Check default parameter value

Default parameter value should not be mutable object, otherwise,
it will be wrong when method is called repeatly and that parameter
is modified in function.

Change-Id: I39127899d5da4866f3f4caa9bd41a586daf2b0f8
see: http://python.net/~goodger/projects/pycon/2007/idiomatic/handout.html#default-parameter-values
Closes-Bug: #1334542

commit_message:
Add "locked" state to Extended Status output

Consumers of the Nova API would like to occasionally see whether
or not an instance has been locked via "nova lock".  Expose this
attribute via Extended Status

Closes-Bug: 1326553
Change-Id: Ida201aca04a2b4d445297f41c91f43a3f726a74e

commit_message:
Save base and target release state correctly

If there are both a neutron and neutron_ml2 database, saving state
would fail in both save-state and grenade.sh.

neutron databases were being saved to BASE not TARGET_RELEASE
in grenade.sh

ceilometer databases were not being saved in grenade.sh

Clean up some whitespace.

Change-Id: I638c6923af65ad612d1329c8c25f534bfdad2d02
Closes-bug: 1358332

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-26 13:26:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add Docker requirement

Use the docker-py module instead of custom REST code in Nova.

This reduces the amount of code we need to maintain and test
as part of OpenStack and separates the concern of maintaining
compatibility with upcoming API versions.

(This patch replaces https://review.openstack.org/#/c/72691/1 as
I cannot restore change and update it)

Change-Id: I30cf4f3e2483de1f3081944faf184af8170a31c3
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-05-05 20:50:00.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Add Docker requirement

We use Docker within Solum, and have to go through custom bash
scripts, or native python call to talk with Docker. Having this
module would help us convert everything into python Code, and
improve testability of our code.

This module would only be used by Solum right now but could benefit
any other project that would use Docker in a near future, including
a potential come-back of the nova docker driver in nova's source

Change-Id: I30cf4f3e2483de1f3081944faf184af8170a31c3
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Add Docker requirement

We use Docker within Solum, and have to go through custom bash
scripts, or native python call to talk with Docker. Having this
module would help us convert everything into python Code, and
improve testability of our code.

This module would only be used by Solum right now but could benefit
any other project that would use Docker in a near future, including
a potential come-back of the nova docker driver in nova's source
tree

Change-Id: I30cf4f3e2483de1f3081944faf184af8170a31c3

commit_message:
Fix pre-downloaded pip tarball not extracted

When installing from a clean devstack repo with pip installation tarball
files/pip-*.tar.gz pre-downloaded in direcotory 'files', the tarball is not
extracted. Fix it by making the extraction unconditional.

Change-Id: I757872fc57d6e0d05f44b703e3934c59444dae01
Closes-Bug: #1322848

commit_message:
Compute "cells" basic API test

This patch implements following compute cell API(JSON)
1. Create a cell
2. List all cells
3. Delete created cell

To make it user dependent config value 'cell' is also added in the
tempest.conf.sample file.

Change-Id: I753142f3b3518318821b71606765b1c04d8d9188

commit_message:
Forbid to attach security services with same type to share network

Manila should not allow attach several security services
with same type to a share network, for example, two LDAPs
or two Active Directory services.

Add unit tests and fix tempest tests.

Closes-bug: #1358652

Change-Id: Id37e986e537941fe8f9086b8b150d6073c97d1ed

commit_message:
objects: Fix InstanceGroup.obj_make_compatible()

The obj_make_compatible() method of the InstanceGroup object
incorrectly assumed the format of the version argument was the version
broken down into int() parts.  It comes in as a string and must be
converted.

Change-Id: Id2724c5029202f001e5a2b4371f030b65c72fdfd

(blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/django-angular-integration)

commit_message:
Makes kombu_ssl_* parameters optional when rabbit_use_ssl => true

The kombu_ssl_* parameters should not be required when rabbit_use_ssl => true
Rather, rabbit_use_ssl must be set to true if the kombu_ssl_* parameters are
used.

Change-Id: Ia3d71eaccdfb736068478b935e5be46719eb49db
Closes-Bug: 1356083

commit_message:
Data Processing Adding support for Spark jobs

This patch adds support for Spark EDP jobs in the
data processing dashboard.  The changes are:
* Add Spark as a job type when creating jobs
* Add some help text for Spark job creation
* Hide appropriate configuration fields when
  launching a Spark job
* Making job type dropdown translateable

Change-Id: I90c0de2cd61110db67673efaec5c9b4ef7f1618f
Implements: blueprint data-processing-spark-support

commit_message:
extra.d to use Sheepdog as devstack backing store.

To use, add "enable_service sheepdog" to your config.

This configures a test Sheepdog cluster with all sheepdog processes
running on the same machine. This uses the "-c local" option for sheep,
which runs the cluster-membership protocol over unix sockets. This is
not intended for production use. Glance and Cinder are then configured
to use the Sheepdog cluster.

For all configurable options, see lib/storage/sheepdog.
Note that this requires a sheepdog version of at least 0.6.0.

Change-Id: I05563b049c33fce3939eb90b6deaee41a78a3532

commit_message:
netifaces 0.10.2 didn't fix all build errors

We had that problem with cent nodes that couldn't build 0.10.0 and
0.10.1, but some ubuntu systems still had trouble with 0.10.2.  All
seems square in 0.10.3.

https://bitbucket.org/al45tair/netifaces/issue/4/build-fails-on-ubuntu-lucid

Change-Id: I1d99134d64dd368547a00cbb43b4822bf7d6fb1d

commit_message:
Disassociate Nova networks during cleanup

Closes-bug: #1350517

Add a dirty hack to deal with cleaning up associated Nova networks
after a Rally run. This was originally being done via the cleanup
classes but after discussing with Boris, it was determined this was
the least-bad way to approach the problem.

Change-Id: Ic52bb0d156dc2adebc9bca2daec660f81d16b31c

subject: Domain IDs in project references are required
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-27 18:48:41.000000000', 'files': ['v3/src/markdown/identity-api-v3.md'], 'message': "Domain IDs in project references are required

Currently, the implementation doesn't allow for `domain_id` in project
create references to be nullable. This change updates the Identity API
to be consistent with the documentation. The alternative would be to
supply a migration to Keystone that changes the backends to not require
`domain_id` and make it truely optional.

Change-Id: I9e1be277c47328dfe14a7f08cbfeee3671f4b382
Closes-Bug: #1362291
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Domain IDs in project references are required

Currently, the implementation doesn't allow for `domain_id` in project
create references to be nullable. This change updates the Identity API
to be consistent with the documentation. The alternative would be to
supply a migration to Keystone that changes the backends to not require
`domain_id` and make it truely optional.

Change-Id: I9e1be277c47328dfe14a7f08cbfeee3671f4b382
Closes-Bug: #1362291

[{'created': '2014-08-19 16:24:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Notification Constant Cleanup and internal notify type

Added a new notification type 'interna' that will never be public
which is utilized for communicating certain things exclusively to the
notification callback system where there is no overlap with the
public notifications (to be put on the bus) or if there are special
case notification data types.

Basic cleanup on constants within the notification callbacks has been
done to utilize a centrally defined set of notification types and
internal-specific user token invalidation. Forward looking some more
constant cleanup will need to occur. Eventually there will be
additional internal-notification types.

This is all in support of removing the dependency of moving to
non-persistent tokens which requires unifying token persistence
management.

commit_message:
Notification Constant Cleanup and internal notify type

Added a new notification type 'internal' that will never be public
which is utilized for communicating certain things exclusively to the
notification callback system where there is no overlap with the
public notifications (to be put on the bus) or if there are special
case notification data types.

Basic cleanup on constants within the notification callbacks has been
done to utilize a centrally defined set of notification types and
internal-specific user token invalidation. Forward looking some more
constant cleanup will need to occur. Eventually there will be
additional internal-notification types.

This is all in support of removing the dependency of moving to
non-persistent tokens which requires unifying token persistence
management.

Change-Id: I16b608e8502f38c3a88579aa1bc91b4af7ed7bc9
bp: non-persistent-tokens

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-25 23:05:50.000000000', 'files': ['tests/benchmark/runners/test_base.py', 'rally/benchmark/runners/base.py', 'tests/benchmark/test_engine.py', 'rally/benchmark/engine.py'], 'message': "Moved context creation to benchmark.engine

Before this patch, context was created in benchmark.runner
base. This patch moved context creation to benchmark.engine.

This change makes the architecture of Rally much cleaner.
e.g. runners don't know anything about benchmark context
(removing one dependency in code)

Change-Id: Id4a99e6257a5c801e2c6099ce33228ea736a8768
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Moved context creation to benchmark.engine

Before this patch, context was created in benchmark.runner
base. This patch moved context creation to benchmark.engine.

This change makes the architecture of Rally much cleaner.
e.g. runners don't know anything about benchmark context
(removing one dependency in code)

Change-Id: Id4a99e6257a5c801e2c6099ce33228ea736a8768

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-27 02:42:48.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_importutils.py', 'oslo/utils/importutils.py'], 'message': "Re-enable _import* hidden methods in import_utils

commit_message:
Re-enable _import* hidden methods in import_utils

There are many scenarios in different projects that end
up needing this support. We should gently nudge everyone
to move to Stevedore but can't mandate it by hiding
these methods.

Change-Id: Ie2783fabf52491a490c999728995da8e68e62cd8

commit_message:
more strong order in Neutron manifests

between keystone roles and inserting 'service' tenant-ID to the neutron config.

commit_message:
Drop tables on v20 downgrade

Like the other migration scripts, the downgrade operation on v20
should restore the database to the state prior to the upgrade.
The current script is leaving the configuration tables untouched
on downgrade, and absorb all exceptions being raised on subsequent
upgrades. The configuration tables may contain bad data that may
cause issues if not cleaned up.

This commit drops the configuration tables on downgrade. The
exception handler on the upgrade function has also been removed.

Change-Id: Id3662ae469f62705fbe96dcdef6cb9f020a49747
Closes-Bug: #1361389

commit_message:
API v1.1: adding id field to messages

Now message's dict in responses contains 'id' field. Affected endpoints
are:

get message by id: GET /v1.1/queues/{queue}/messages/{message_id}
list messages: GET /v1.1/queues/{queue}/messages?{ids}
pop messages: DELETE /v1.1/queues/{queue}/messages?pop=

Change-Id: I4ca5a5ef22abe05b3d7bc39ebe7d1fc742e21eb4
Partially-implements: blueprint api-v1.1-response-document-changes

commit_message:
Update RESP message when failed to create flavor

The response message is unexpected(not easy to understand),if
requested resource exceeded limitation when to create flavor.
Because the error message used DB model fields but not that
used by API body. Such as following response message:
"Invalid input received: memory_mb must be <= 2147483647"
'memory_mb' is DB model field but 'ram' used in REST API

Change "memory_mb" to "ram", "root_gb" to "disk" and
"ephemeral_gb" to "ephemeral".

Change-Id: I43e2f307d21325a6b54815edf157f3d5fa1135e5
Fixes: bug #1350751

commit_message:
Make USE_MARIADB overrideable

The $USE_MARIADB environment variable needs to be overrideable otherwise
settings in tripleorc/devtestrc are not going to have any effect.

Change-Id: I3e4bb4005068b2b5143b2f5d7eecd6ef1b4406ad

subject: Change service VM connectivity
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 7534, 'name': 'Yulia Portnova', 'email': 'yportnova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'yportnova'}, {'_account_id': 8851, 'name': 'Valeriy Ponomaryov', 'email': 'kiparis.kh@gmail.com', 'username': 'vponomaryov'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-06 14:13:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Change service VM connectivity

Add new config option(boolean) "put_share_in_private_notwork". If it not
set we use old VM connectivity method i.e. route request to share into
service network/subnet.

If it set, we use direct VM connection. In this case share VM will have
2 interface, eth1 attached to service network/subnet and eth1 attached
to shared network.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/manila/+spec/direct-service-vm-connectivity

Change-Id: I794a7ce158a3f17a55f4277b669ce0bb8ecfc180
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-06 15:07:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Change service VM connectivity

Add new config option(boolean) "put_share_in_private_network". If it is
not set we use old VM connectivity method i.e. route request to share
into service network/subnet.

If it is set, we use direct VM connection. In this case share VM will
have 2 interfaces: eth0 attached to service network/subnet and eth1
attached to tenant network.

Implements blueprint direct-service-vm-connectivity
Change-Id: I794a7ce158a3f17a55f4277b669ce0bb8ecfc180
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-08-06 15:55:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Change service VM connectivity

Add new config option(boolean) "put_share_in_private_network". If it is
not set we use old VM connectivity method i.e. route request to share
into service network/subnet.

If it is set, we use direct VM connection. In this case share VM will
have 2 interfaces: eth0 attached to service network/subnet and eth1

commit_message:
Change service VM connectivity

Add new config option(boolean) "connect_share_server_to_tenant_network".
If it is not set we use old VM connectivity method i.e. route request to
share into service network/subnet.

If it is set, we use direct VM connection. In this case share VM will
have 2 interfaces: eth0 attached to service network/subnet and eth1
attached to tenant network.

Implements blueprint direct-service-vm-connectivity
Change-Id: I794a7ce158a3f17a55f4277b669ce0bb8ecfc180

commit_message:
Document all nova.conf sections

Document all nova.conf sections, sort them in the same order as
nova.conf (first DEFAULT, rest alphabetically).
Use xlink for cells entry instead of external link.

Change-Id: I8796799f2a5c1977acdb1b511817604e93e92ba1
Closes-Bug: #1347162

commit_message:
Added selective public network serialization

Added hepler method objects.Node.should_have_public() to determine
is it required to assign Public network IPs to particular node.
It is checked on IPs assignment and deployment data serialization.

Closes-Bug: #1272349

Change-Id: I80d3ccdcc8e4b440f40f5b6e089532adaa5d02df

commit_message:
Add nodepool

As we are going to use a bit different version of nodepool
it looks a good idea to 'fork' its copy here, to track all
subsequent updates.

See 'forked-from' for more information about commit we forked from.

Change-Id: Iff55f3a411986f4c89f934c4422d5140b0698c80

commit_message:
GlusterFS: Use image_utils for tempfile creation

Besides the aesthetical aspect of replacing ad-hoc code
with an utility function, it's more correct
to perform image conversions in CONF.image_conversion_dir,
which is taken care by the image_utils.temporary_file()
context guard.

Change-Id: Ied5607156f0ab1f1f8cfc889d5b57f3486d6b407

commit_message:
Add test for checking token issued_at time

Add a test to check that if we have a v2.0 token, and we use that token
with /v3/auth/tokens/ GET api calls, the 'issued_at' time should not
change.

Change-Id: Ib53ebbc833b623fc39d4e37d45827796a51a7b03
Partial-Bug: #1348820

subject: Made provision for glance service to use Launcher
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-27 15:00:48.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/v1/test_misc.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v1/test_multiprocessing.py', 'glance/tests/functional/test_gzip_middleware.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v2/test_schemas.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_service.py', 'glance/tests/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/functional/test_client_redirects.py', 'glance/cmd/registry.py', 'glance/tests/functional/test_bin_glance_cache_manage.py', 'glance/tests/unit/api/test_cmd.py', 'glance/service.py', 'glance/tests/utils.py', 'glance/tests/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v2/test_images.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v2/test_tasks.py', 'glance/tests/functional/test_cache_middleware.py', 'glance/tests/functional/test_client_exceptions.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v1/test_copy_to_file.py', 'glance/tests/functional/test_api.py', 'glance/common/wsgi.py', 'glance/tests/functional/db/test_rpc_endpoint.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v1/test_ssl.py', 'glance/tests/functional/test_scrubber.py', 'glance/cmd/api.py', 'glance/tests/functional/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/functional/test_logging.py'], 'message': "Made provision for glance service to use Launcher

After sending SIGHUP signal to glance-service parent process,
it will call SIGHUP callback handler and then throws OSError.
The OSError is thrown because os.wait system call was
interrupted due to SIGHUP callback handler. As a result of
this parent process closes the server socket.
All child processes also gets terminated without completing
existing api requests because the server socket is already
closed and the service doesn't restart.

Added service module, launcher and common service module with
its dependencies from oslo-incubator in glance service.

After modifying the implemenatation, glance-service is able to
restart on sending SIGHUP signal to parent process and also
completing existing api requests.

Made provision to pass default hub to eventlet.hubs.use_hub()
in oslo-incubator common service famework. Defined new configuration
parameter 'eventlet_hub' with default value as 'poll' in glance.cmd.api
and glance.cmd.registry  and leveraged same to service framework of
oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: I6782e55e9ca280c6f4be54202d8e443b4475e96a
blueprint:use-common-service-framework
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Made provision for glance service to use Launcher

After sending SIGHUP signal to glance-service parent process,
it will call SIGHUP callback handler and then throws OSError.
The OSError is thrown because os.wait system call was
interrupted due to SIGHUP callback handler. As a result of
this parent process closes the server socket.
All child processes also gets terminated without completing
existing api requests because the server socket is already
closed and the service doesn't restart.

Added service module, launcher and common service module with
its dependencies from oslo-incubator in glance service.

After modifying the implemenatation, glance-service is able to
restart on sending SIGHUP signal to parent process and also
completing existing api requests.

Made provision to pass default hub to eventlet.hubs.use_hub()
in oslo-incubator common service famework. Defined new configuration
parameter 'eventlet_hub' with default value as 'poll' in glance.cmd.api
and glance.cmd.registry  and leveraged same to service framework of
oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: I6782e55e9ca280c6f4be54202d8e443b4475e96a
blueprint:use-common-service-framework

commit_message:
make external network type as 'local'

and remove it from bridge mappings.
Network, which is used as a source of Floating-IP
should not be associated with any external interface.
It's not needed since Grizzly release.

Partial-Bug: #1357298
Related-bug: #1272349
Closes-bug: #1260051
Change-Id: I62c7ebaa099c3580ddb68c2a8906e1cd2321ba58

commit_message:
Using arithmetic transformers in pipeline

Arithmetic transformers has been just finished in Ceilometer.
That allows us to move very ugly computation of percentage
from TripleO-UI to Ceilometer pipeline, where it belongs.

Adding computation of swap and cpu utilization.

Change-Id: I69fc1b4ebf740e34d24b26eff922b6b40e72c08a

commit_message:
libvirt: Remove unecessary suffix defaulting

The defaulting of suffix is being done in function signature, so the
additional check in the function body is unecessary.

Change-Id: I8fb6c2d0d71761818430b5d6500e49fc70dad890

commit_message:
Tune net_check generator params

Huge load of traffic could not be processed under time
constraints that we have either in system tests/orchestrator

- change duration of traffic generation to 5 sec
- send only 1 packets in each iteration

Change-Id: Ia503c2df72bca82952c51ac794615faa374ebf21
Closes-Bug: #1306705

commit_message:
Generate traffic for a given amount of time

Sending prefefined amount of packets for each interface:vlan pair
can still result in random verify_networks failures on heavily loaded
environments

- sender will generate traffic based on time provided with --duration option
  or from config file, defaults to 20 sec
- repeat option will be used to configure amount of packets per iface:vlan
  pair sended in each iteration, defaults to 2 packets

Change-Id: Ie92a3ea175ca2ae9f43e79f66b449366a1b68126
Partial-Bug: 1306705

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-27 07:40:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use tcpdump for traffic dumping in net_probe

I found out that tcpdump much more reliable than
python libpcap bindings, and works well under load

- start tcpdump listeners for each iface
  (will catch both tagged/untagged traffic)
- deserealize pcap data with help of scapy rdpcap util
- all pcap file will be stored in /var/run/pcap_dir by default
  and maybe attached to diagnostic snapshot

commit_message:
Use tcpdump for traffic dumping in net_probe

I found out that tcpdump much more reliable than
python libpcap bindings, and works well under load

- start tcpdump listeners for each iface
  (will catch both tagged/untagged traffic)
- deserealize pcap data with help of scapy rdpcap util
- all pcap file will be stored in /var/run/pcap_dir by default
  and maybe attached to diagnostic snapshot

Change-Id: Id8320d4a05c84687c7a0a3d0ddbce4d05a7115ea
Closes-Bug: 1306705
