commit_message:
Add support for creating vfat and iso images

This commit introduces support for creating vfat images
and iso images in ironic. Vfat images will be used for
passing information to baremetal node using virtual
media through OOB channel. Iso images will be used for
booting up baremetal nodes via virtual media.

Change-Id: I42b88da02090aec310f567642d3174d0f482b585
Implements: blueprint ironic-ilo-virtualmedia-driver

commit_message:
Fix cache deletion within policy enforcer

policy enforcer has 'clear' method, that deletes rules and cached file,
but used wrong key for cache deletion and cached file is not really deleted.

Reason - used for cache creation 'policy_path' was never saved within enforcer.

Change-Id: I289abd008a916fd83448692d1ebf39cd30bbab4d
Closes-Bug: #1347728

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-22 15:37:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix CellStateManagerFile init to failure

Currently, specifying a cells_config file in nova.conf causes
CellStateManager to fail and in turn stops the nova-cells service from
starting. The reason is that CellsManager creates an instance of
CellStateManager with no arguments. CellStateManager __new__ runs and
creates an instance of CellStateManagerFile which runs __new__ and
__init__ with cell_state_cls and cells_config_path set. At this point
__new__ returns CellStateManagerFile and the new instance's __init__
method is invoked (CellStateManagerFile.__init__) with the original
arguments (there weren't any) which then results in:
2014-04-29 11:52:05.240 16759 TRACE nova self.state_manager =
cell_state_manager()
2014-04-29 11:52:05.240 16759 TRACE nova TypeError: __init__() takes
exactly 3 arguments (1 given)

It seems reasonable for CellStateManagerFile to derive the
cells_config_path info for itself so I have updated the code with that
change and added unit tests to catch this bug and to check that the
correct managers are still returned

Change-Id: I9021640515142a3ca95c2d9e7b03e19b529bc175
Closes-Bug: #1314677
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-22 17:15:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix CellStateManagerFile init to failure

Currently, specifying a cells_config file in nova.conf causes
CellStateManager to fail and in turn stops the nova-cells service from
starting. The reason is that CellsManager creates an instance of
CellStateManager with no arguments. CellStateManager __new__ runs and
creates an instance of CellStateManagerFile which runs __new__ and
__init__ with cell_state_cls and cells_config_path set. At this point
__new__ returns CellStateManagerFile and the new instance's __init__
method is invoked (CellStateManagerFile.__init__) with the original
arguments (there weren't any) which then results in:
2014-04-29 11:52:05.240 16759 TRACE nova self.state_manager =
cell_state_manager()
2014-04-29 11:52:05.240 16759 TRACE nova TypeError: __init__() takes
exactly 3 arguments (1 given)

It seems reasonable for CellStateManagerFile to derive the
cells_config_path info for itself so I have updated the code with that
change and added unit tests to catch this bug and to check that the
correct managers are still returned

Change-Id: I9021640515142a3ca95c2d9e7b03e19b529bc175
Closes-Bug: #1314677
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-08-01 11:44:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix CellStateManagerFile init to failure

Currently, specifying a cells_config file in nova.conf causes
CellStateManager to fail and in turn stops the nova-cells service from
starting. The reason is that CellsManager creates an instance of
CellStateManager with no arguments. CellStateManager __new__ runs and
creates an instance of CellStateManagerFile which runs __new__ and
__init__ with cell_state_cls and cells_config_path set. At this point
__new__ returns CellStateManagerFile and the new instance's __init__
method is invoked (CellStateManagerFile.__init__) with the original
arguments (there weren't any) which then results in:
2014-04-29 11:52:05.240 16759 TRACE nova self.state_manager =
cell_state_manager()
2014-04-29 11:52:05.240 16759 TRACE nova TypeError: __init__() takes
exactly 3 arguments (1 given)

It seems reasonable for CellStateManagerFile to derive the
cells_config_path info for itself so I have updated the code with that
change and added unit tests to catch this bug and to check that the
correct managers are still returned

Change-Id: I9021640515142a3ca95c2d9e7b03e19b529bc175
Closes-Bug: #1314677

commit_message:
Fix CellStateManagerFile init to failure

Currently, specifying a cells_config file in nova.conf causes
CellStateManager to fail and in turn stops the nova-cells service from
starting. The reason is that CellsManager creates an instance of
CellStateManager with no arguments. CellStateManager __new__ runs and
creates an instance of CellStateManagerFile which runs __new__ and
__init__ with cell_state_cls and cells_config_path set. At this point
__new__ returns CellStateManagerFile and the new instance's __init__
method is invoked (CellStateManagerFile.__init__) with the original
arguments (there weren't any) which then results in:
2014-04-29 11:52:05.240 16759 TRACE nova self.state_manager =
cell_state_manager()
2014-04-29 11:52:05.240 16759 TRACE nova TypeError: __init__() takes
exactly 3 arguments (1 given)

It seems reasonable for CellStateManagerFile to derive the
cells_config_path info for itself so I have updated the code with that
change and added unit tests to catch this bug and to check that the
correct managers are still returned

Change-Id: I9021640515142a3ca95c2d9e7b03e19b529bc175
Closes-Bug: #1314677

commit_message:
Handle a flavor create failed better

Catch FlavorCreateFailed exceptions which when flavor creation fails.
This type of flavor creation failure is caused by an internal nova problem.
Return an internal server error (500) to the user so they know
to contact their cloud provider.

Closes-Bug: #1292309

Change-Id: I268c84dae290b0170448d789509af781555df9b0

commit_message:
Run keystone-manage db_sync every time on Fuel Master

This is necessary in the event that keystone puppet
run failed the first time due to partial failure
and skips db_sync on the second run and fails
on another keystone task.

Change-Id: I6c7956ffd757eeaa7bb6445d701d809f869d28e1
Closes-Bug: #1362139

Cinder volumes, cinder-volume on a cinder node would fail to connect to Ceph
because ceph.conf isn't there.

Change-Id: I1c4119fbfca3db5f234b18e1e03b7e31b971287e
Closes-Bug: 1319106
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Pull ceph.conf for cinder role

In a rare scenario of having cinder nodes (providing storage for Cinder LVM
backend) in an OpenStack environment configured to use Ceph RBD as backend for
Cinder volumes, cinder-volume on a cinder node would fail to connect to Ceph
because ceph.conf isn't there.

Change-Id: I1c4119fbfca3db5f234b18e1e03b7e31b971287e
Closes-Bug: 1319106

commit_message:
Flake8: Fix and enable H405

Fix H405:
H405  multi line docstring summary not separated with an empty line

With this patch, flake8 passes all checks (incl. hacking checks)
except the on-purpose disabled check H904.
Closes-Bug: #1333290

Change-Id: If41259aefc4d6d588da5036f1f25df17b88db04f

commit_message:
Create a Scheduler client library

Proposal for designing scheduler client library hooking existing
select_destinations() and providing new update_resource_stats()
for decorrelating direct calls to conductor for ComputeNode table
and scheduler API

WIP - this is just an example patch to see what bauzas thinks

Implements: blueprint scheduler-lib

Change-Id: I0ee2b925de98713c62c2552e4ec6ad131684ca2b

commit_message:
Show validation errors in modal forms

Selector '.modal span.help-block' is the exact one for the
validation messages. It might have been used for some
other purpose previously, but now it breaks the things.

Change-Id: Ibb55f06533a21fc425a6bdac9b71b7e489223dd1
Closes-Bug: #1351298

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-21 14:02:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix device mount/umount method in generic driver

Generic driver has methods for mounting block devices and unmounting,
they has logic, that depends on exception messages.
This fix removes dependency on message of exception in mentioned
methods, because it should be distro-independent, for example, it
fails with cirros image.

Changes:
- added new method '_is_mount_present'
- rewritten method '_mount_device'
- rewritten method '_unmount_device'
- rewritten unittests

Change-Id: I21500c83c00640d13f40ebb992d59d311fd3ef1e
Closes-Bug: #1359196

commit_message:
Fix device mount/umount methods in generic driver

Generic driver has methods for mounting block devices and unmounting.
They have logic, that depends on exception messages.
This change removes dependency on messages of exceptions in mentioned
methods to avoid distro-incompatibility.

Changes:
- added new method '_is_device_mounted'
- rewritten method '_mount_device'
- rewritten method '_unmount_device'
- rewritten unittests
- added locks to mount/unmount methods by share-id

Change-Id: I21500c83c00640d13f40ebb992d59d311fd3ef1e
Closes-Bug: #1359196

commit_message:
libvirt: display warning message if firewalld is enabled

Libvirt versions < 1.2.4 are very inefficient at talking to
firewalld. This results in slow VM startup/shutdown which
in turn causes tempest to often time out.

Display a warning if firewalld is enabled on distros which
commonly have this inefficient combination enabled, so that
developers can decide whether to disable firewalld or to
update their libvirt or ignore the problem.

Change-Id: I1dc610dfb8966e6e4e70c19416ee85e332bde9f2

Implementation of schema comparison

A DB schema comparison base test case realized in the 0.3.0 version of
oslo.db. To implement the feature in a projects we should restrict the
version of installed oslo.db library at 0.3.0.

commit_message:
Big Switch: Only update hash header on success

This patch moves the hash update call into the success block
of the server manager so the database isn't updated with
a hash header from an error response. Additionally, it prevents
the hash from being updated to an empty value if the hash header
is not present in the response.

Closes-Bug: #1348766
Change-Id: I512d01f9bb91b208dd58883d2464951ecc6748e1

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7007, 'name': 'Pranav Salunke', 'email': 'dguitarbite@gmail.com', 'username': 'dguitarbite'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-27 12:24:15.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash.sh', 'labs/lib/osbash/functions.host'], 'message': 'labs: osbash.sh options: drop -f, add -b

Add a -b option for building node VMs. This should make it harder for
users to accidentally overwrite their existing VMs.

It also allows us to drop the rather confusing "-f" option; "-w" without
"-b" is fast now, because no local building is ordered. To build node
VMs locally and Windows batch files at the same time, "-b -w" (or "-bw")
can be used.

Change-Id: I17ec78c0625f3657adaf670b7d58f2e4fde2248b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
labs: osbash.sh options: drop -f, add -b

Add a -b option for building node VMs. This should make it harder for
users to accidentally overwrite their existing VMs.

It also allows us to drop the rather confusing "-f" option; "-w" without
"-b" is fast now, because no local building is ordered. To build node
VMs locally and Windows batch files at the same time, "-b -w" (or "-bw")
can be used.

Change-Id: I17ec78c0625f3657adaf670b7d58f2e4fde2248b

commit_message:
labs: fix wbatch_reset calls

Don't call wbatch_reset (to clean the wbatch directory) if -n (dry-run)
option is provided, but do call wbatch_reset even when not in fast mode
(-f).

commit_message:
Backport MongoDB fixes to old manifests

In order to provide working rollback feature for Mongo role we should
backport mongo-related fixes to installed 5.0 and 5.0.1 manifests.

Change-Id: I8abd3af86485408fb45ef4550eec711c1dac272f
Closes-Bug: #1360289

commit_message:
Make usage_from_instances consider current usage

VirtNUMAHostTopology.usage_from_instances will now consider the current
usage of the passed host, and also accepts a 'free' keyword argument,
which if set to True, will cause the instance usage to be taken out of
the considered host. Also adds better handling of  None and emtpy
params.

Blueprint: virt-driver-numa-placement
Change-Id: I62c59b5e1dcbd4db247282f170c6f2f501bafd3d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9444, 'name': 'gustavo panizzo', 'email': 'gfa@zumbi.com.ar', 'username': 'gfa'}, {'_account_id': 9569, 'name': 'Sergey Nikitin', 'email': 'nikitinserv@gmail.com', 'username': 'snikitin'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-08 02:19:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow attaching external networks based on configurable policy

Commit da66d50010d5b1ba1d7fc9c3d59d81b6c01bb0b0 restricted
attaching external networks to admin clients. This patch changes
it to a policy based check instead with the default setting being
admin only. This allows operators to more precisely configure who
they wish to allow to attach external networks without having to
give them admin access

Change-Id: I59e71f117f889f2abffddc36c1870ef1e0fe3711
DocImpact: Adds network:attach_external_network policy
Closes-Bug: #1352102

admin only. This allows operators to more precisely configure who

commit_message:
Allow attaching external networks based on configurable policy

Commit da66d50010d5b1ba1d7fc9c3d59d81b6c01bb0b0 restricted
attaching external networks to admin clients. This patch changes
it to a policy based check instead with the default setting being
admin only. This allows operators to more precisely configure who
they wish to allow to attach external networks without having to
give them admin access

Change-Id: I59e71f117f889f2abffddc36c1870ef1e0fe3711
DocImpact: Adds network:attach_external_network policy
Closes-Bug: #1352102

and move those to respective clients.

commit_message:
Fixes manila quota-show information with wrong tenant-id

After running following command as admin, quota-show displays the default information
eventhough perticular tenant-id does not exists:
  manila quota-show --tenant abcd
The fix has been applied so that quota-show with wrong tenant-id will display
an error with "TenantID not found"

Closes-Bug: #1234244
Change-Id: I604f5ee445863b7597aac3cb74607c8c54e9cb45

Move API response success check to Neutron client

* Move all API response success validation from Neutron API tests to
  Neutron base/json/xml clients

commit_message:
Flake8: Fix H302

Fix H302 and enable the test:
H302  import only modules.'from X import Y' does not import a module

commit_message:
Handle upper cased endpoints

The location header returns a lower cased hostname so make sure
we match on a case-less endpoint.

Change-Id: I58b53b73d4c4e06b8b3026966cbb72963a0fec9a
Closes-bug: #1308992

commit_message:
Add replication slave info to instance show

Update the 'show' response for an instance:

 - If the instance is a replication slave, include the slave_of id.
 - If the instance is a replication master, include the list of slave
   instance ids.

Update the 'list' response to include the slave_of id.
Add CheckInstance tests for slave/slave_of info.

(Unrelated: remove a #TODO comment that has already been addressed.)

Partially Implements: blueprint replication-v1
Closes-Bug: #1340359
Change-Id: If8a154083d0095606fb3ee115cc9b66ab788cbb4

commit_message:
Snapshot component for replication

Implements the snapshot capability for replication by
taking a backup of the master site, then using it
to populate the slave, then turning on replication.

Co-Authored-By: Greg Lucas <glucas@tesora.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Manchanda <SlickNik@gmail.com>

Partially implements: blueprint replication-v1
Change-Id: Ibd3214b2ffafb250f0cc794c6ee0ff6b0d2ed7da

subject: Do not install pip in heat config element
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 8537, 'name': 'Visnusaran Murugan', 'email': 'visnusaran.murugan@hp.com', 'username': 'Vishnu'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-05 22:55:49.000000000', 'files': ['hot/software-config/elements/heat-config/install.d/50-heat-config'], 'message': 'Do not install pip in heat config element

Since this element depends on os-apply-config and os-refresh-config, and
the two depends on pip-and-virtualenv. pip command has been installed in
pip-and-virtualenv.

If we install pip via install-packages here, for these images which have
no python-pip in repository, the installation will fail.

Change-Id: I4284bdd293213321751439272bad439e2a899005
Closes-Bug: #1352689
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not install pip in heat config element

Since this element depends on os-apply-config and os-refresh-config, and
the two depends on pip-and-virtualenv. pip command has been installed in
pip-and-virtualenv.

If we install pip via install-packages here, for these images which have
no python-pip in repository, the installation will fail.

Change-Id: I4284bdd293213321751439272bad439e2a899005
Closes-Bug: #1352689

subject: Pass password for SNMPd correctly
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7585, 'name': 'Ladislav Smola', 'email': 'lsmola@redhat.com', 'username': 'lsmola'}, {'_account_id': 8041, 'name': 'Petr Blaho', 'email': 'pblaho@redhat.com', 'username': 'pblaho'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-19 11:30:34.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh', 'scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh'], 'message': "Pass password for SNMPd correctly

Password for Overcloud SNMPd needs to be passed through TE_DATAFILE
otherwise it is not set correctly and Undercloud Ceilometer can't
monitor Overcloud.

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Pass password for SNMPd correctly

Password for Overcloud SNMPd needs to be passed through TE_DATAFILE
otherwise it is not set correctly and Undercloud Ceilometer can't
monitor Overcloud.

Change-Id: Ie492f2556151b3c739ed07a8b0b818ed7c1fafe3
